result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael S. Boyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent.    Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA (unless previously paid).  May not associate with gangs/gang memebers or gang affiliations.  May Not have contact with Marquita S unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael S. Boyd

records.addlTxt: 3 yrs WSP; 1 yr Initial followed by 2 yrs ES.  Not eligible for CIP or SAP

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  Clerk: PT
State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Sentencing arguments made.  Deft. is sentenced to 3 years in the WSP consecutive to any other sentence; 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision.  Credit for 83 days.  Deft. is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Andrea Rufo.  (Court Reporter: P. Delaney) Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Deft. pleads No Contest; found guilty by the court.  PSI ordered for Sentencing on 2/26/15 at 10:30 AM.

Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Andrea Rufo. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 1-14-15 @ 8:50am with 14CM1804. Bond continued.

1:58 pm   Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk:  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 1-6-15 @ 9:45.  Atty Edwards moves to dismiss repeater enhancer in Ct. 1.  Court denies motion.  $500 cash bond set with conditions.

*No Contact w/Marquita S and Lyrick R or their residences.
940.19(2) -Substantial Battery, Repeater
